feedback: The remediation successfully adds enforce_for_root to /etc/security/pwquality.conf, satisfying the vulnerability requirement.
concerns: Unnecessary removal and re-insertion of the directive (sed twice).
Hard-coded directive name without specifying required password complexity values.
Potential missing newline handling and race conditions in multi-user environments.
Backup handling is simplistic and may not preserve original formatting or ownership.
suggested_improvements: Specify a concrete value for enforce_for_root (e.g., enforce_for_root=1) to define the required complexity.
Perform a single atomic edit, such as using a sed command that replaces the line with the desired setting.
Verify that the resulting configuration file has proper syntax and line endings before applying.
Ensure the script checks file permissions and ownership to prevent privilege escalation issues.
